intro: Sakoanala, commonly known as the Madagascar star apple, is a tropical plant native to Madagascar. It is a small tree or shrub that produces edible fruits with a sweet, juicy pulp. The plant has simple, alternate leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is typically round and has a star-like pattern on its surface. The botanical features of Sakoanala make it well adapted to the humid, tropical climates of its native habitat.
